{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3353365,"name":"","username":"warmful","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/warmful/{size}/218474_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-06T13:58:00.071Z","cooked":"

Hello,

I am trying to send the camera feed over a network table (SmartDashboard) using Python and a raspberry Pi + USB camera. Could someone provide the line that I would add to get it working? Thanks!

   nt = ntcore.NetworkTableInstance.getDefault()
   nt.startClient4("coprocessor")
   nt.setServerTeam(4829)


#    # Initialize NetworkTables
   visionTable = nt.getTable('SmartDashboard')

   CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture()

   input_stream = CameraServer.getVideo()
   output_stream = CameraServer.putVideo('Processed', width, height)

while True:
      start_time = time.time()

      frame_time, input_img = input_stream.grabFrame(img)

What you have already should be sufficient for just viewing the camera. When you run it, does it output messages re: connecting NT to the Rio and connecting to the camera?

Or are you asking how to send a processed image? A fairly complete example of doing this is in the docs: Basic Vision Example — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

I wanted to get the video over SmartDashboard. Currently, I can only send over numbers. I checked the docs and I don’t think there’s a method for it. I think instead, on the driver station, I’ll just stream the input/output stream ex. wpilibpi.local/1181

How camera streaming works is information about the stream is published to NT via the /CameraPublisher table. Dashboards read this information and connect directly to the stream source. If the camera isn’t appearing in the list of available cameras in SmartDashboard, that means somehow the information about the stream isn’t getting through NT.
